text: {{Infobox settlement | name = Province of Forlì-Cesena | native_name = | native_name_lang = it | settlement_type = Province | image_skyline = Forlicesena forli.jpg | image_alt = Piazza Aurelio Saffi, Forlì | image_caption = Piazza Aurelio Saffi, Forlì | image_flag = Flag of the Province of Forlì-Cesena.svg | flag_alt = | image_shield = Provincia di Forlì-Cesena-Stemma.svg | shield_alt = | image_map = Forli-Cesena in Italy.svg | map_alt = Map with the province of Forlì-Cesena in Italy | map_caption = Map with the province of Forlì-Cesena, in red, in Italy | coordinates = | subdivision_type = Country | subdivision_name = | subdivision_type1 = Region | subdivision_name1 = Emilia-Romagna | established_title = | established_date = | seat_type = Capital | seat = Forlì | parts_type = Comuni | parts_style = para | p1 = 30 | government_footnotes = | leader_party = | leader_title = President | leader_name = Davide Drei | unit_pref = Metric | area_footnotes = | area_total_km2 = 2378.40 | elevation_footnotes = | elevation_m = | population_footnotes = | population_total = 394067 | population_as_of = January 2017 | population_density_km2 = auto | timezone1 = CET | utc_offset1 = +1 | timezone1_DST = CEST | utc_offset1_DST = +2 | postal_code_type = Postal code | postal_code = 47121 - 47122 Forlì, 47521 - 47522 Cesena | area_code_type = Telephone prefix | area_code = 0543, 0547 | iso_code = IT-FC | registration_plate = FC | blank_name_sec1 = ISTAT | blank_info_sec1 = 040 | website = Official website | footnotes = }} The province of Forlì-Cesena () is a province in the Emilia-Romagna region in northeastern Italy, on the Adriatic Sea. Its capital is the city of Forlì. ==History== The province was created as Province of Forlì with the car plates FO. In 1992, the southern part of the province was separated to form the new Province of Rimini and the name of the province was changed to the present of Province of Forlì-Cesena and the car plates were changed in 1999 to FC. The ISO 3166-2 of the province was also changed to FC in 2010.ISO Newsletter 19/02/2010 ==Geography== The province of Forlì-Cesena has an area of . It is, together with the Rimini province, the most southerly of the provinces in the Emilia-Romagna region; it has a short coast along the Adriatic Sea. The provincial capital, the city of Forlì, is along the Montone river and at about southeast of Bologna, the capital of the region. The province is bordered to the north by the province of Ravenna, to the northwest by the province of Mantua in Lombardy, to the west by the province of Florence province in Tuscany, to the south by the province of Arezzo, also in Tuscany, to the southeast by the Rimini and to the east by the Adriatic Sea. In the province there are two main protected areas: * Parco naturale del fiume Savio (Natural park of the Savio river), along the Savio river; and * Parco nazionale delle Foreste Casentinesi, Monte Falterona e Campigna, a national park in the northern Apennines. ==Population== There are 394,067 persons living in the province (January 2017), for a population density of inhabitants/km². ==Administration== The following shows the 30 comuni with the population, and the area and altitude.
